image.altText: The entrance to Elizabeth City Centre shopping centre in Adelaide's north.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide shopping centre is in lockdown and people are being evacuated following a "violent disturbance".

title.children: Breaking: Lockdown and injuries at Adelaide shopping centre following reported fight

image.altText: A man with a beard and grey hair on an old boat

props.synopsis: A coroner has found Anthony Higgins, who went missing in 2020 sparking the largest and most expensive marine search in South Australian waters, died two weeks later when he went missing again.

title.children: Boatie who went missing twice died from 'exposure to the sea'

image.altText: Officer holds up large bag of drugs at police headquarters

props.synopsis: Police say a man has been charged for allegedly carrying $2.75 million worth of illicit drugs while travelling on a bus from Melbourne to Adelaide overnight.

title.children: Man allegedly travelled with $2.75m drug haul on bus from Melbourne to Adelaide

image.altText: A woman in a red top and jeans standing next to a large scale machine with rolls of paper inside it.

props.synopsis: With Broken Hill's Barrier Truth newspaper in the process of selling off its usable assets, some wonder if its still-working press would be more valuable as scrap or even a museum piece.

title.children: Outback printing press faces scrap or museum as Barrier Truth winds down

image.altText: Broken down on the Birdsville Track

props.synopsis: The ABC's Landline crew discovers extreme kindness with a can-do attitude after a mechanical breakdown in South Australia's outback.

title.children: Broken down on the Birdsville Track in search of a cattle-carrying boat

image.altText: Two men amid bushes in a sandy area stand next to drilling equipment.

props.synopsis: Infrastructure to monitor the impact of rising sea levels and storm surges on the Coorong in South Australia has been installed along the thin strip of coastline between Goolwa Beach and the lagoons of the Ramsar-listed wetland.

title.children: Scientist drills into dunes to collect storm surge data at renowned wetland

image.altText: Sea foam on a pavement next to the beach with a cyclist riding by

props.synopsis: Authorities say metropolitan testing shows Karenia algal levels remain low compared with last month, despite thick foam and fish deaths seen on some beaches in recent days.

title.children: Dead fish, foam seen on metro beaches despite overall low algal levels

image.altText: Green chardonnay grapes sit on vines in bunches.

props.synopsis: The wine grape industry has written to the SA government pleading for help as it reaches breaking point after indicative pricing for the next vintage is released showing growers could face losses of up to $270 per tonne.

title.children: White wine grape growers already in crisis suffer 'another kick in the guts'

image.altText: Girl holding up mobile phone with boarding house sign behind her

props.synopsis: Regional and remote students are being encouraged to learn old-school ways to stay in contact as social media bans for those under 16 come into effect over the summer holidays.

title.children: What the social media ban means for rural boarding school students

image.altText: Honeybees on a frame, beekeeper points a finger at the queen bee.

props.synopsis: Beekeepers are being urged to monitor their hives more frequently after further detections of the deadly bee parasite varroa mite in South Australia.

title.children: Varroa mite detected in bee hives in two more SA locations

image.altText: A man wearing a hi-viz vest and hard hat walks towards batteries with Tesla written on them

props.synopsis: One of Australia's largest battery energy storage systems would be built on farmland in South Australia's south-east in a proposal that the developer says will lower electricity costs.

title.children: Concerns SA's 'best agricultural land' being taken up by battery projects

image.altText: Noarlunga Hospital sign

props.synopsis: An Adelaide woman is suing a southern suburbs hospital for $1.5 million in damages alleging she suffered a "permanent neurological injury" when doctors failed to diagnose her with a stroke, court documents reveal.

title.children: SA woman suffered permanent brain injury after hospital failed to diagnose stroke, court hears

image.altText: A white sign on a building reading "Monash IVF"

props.synopsis: Monash IVF has been ordered to be more rigorous when checking the biological origin of embryos to avoid more mix-ups, in order to stay registered in Victoria.

title.children: Major IVF provider hit with restrictions after embryo bungle

image.altText: A split-screen image of a man and a woman, both wearing National Guard uniforms.

props.synopsis: Sarah Beckstrom, 20, has died in hospital after an ambush shooting near the White House on Wednesday. A male soldier who was also shot, Andrew Wolfe, is fighting for his life, the president says.

title.children: Donald Trump says National Guard soldier shot in Washington DC has died

image.altText: A group of formally dressed people smile and hold trophies in celebration in a group portrait on the edge of a stage.

props.synopsis: The pair's investigation had an immediate impact on Australia's childcare industry, resulting in the suspension of one centre and a raft of government policy changes and safety reforms.

title.children: ABC's Adele Ferguson, Chris Gillett win Gold Walkley for childcare investigation

image.altText: Environment Minister Murray Watt walks in the Senate.

props.synopsis: The environmental deal is a major win for a government whose critics on the left are calling for it to be more reformist.

title.children: Greens out-step flat-footed Liberals on crucial deal

image.altText: Soldiers standing on the side of a building with two other men near a broken garage door on the ground

props.synopsis: Video has emerged appearing to show two Palestinians being 'executed' by Israeli forces in the West Bank, with the Israeli military saying it has launched an investigation into the incident.

title.children: Video appears to show Israeli soldiers 'executing' two Palestinians in West Bank

image.altText: Anthony Albanese points.

props.synopsis: The federal government's overhauled national environment laws have passed parliament.

title.children: PM declares Labor-Greens deal a 'yesalition' as environment bill passes — as it happened

image.altText: A teenager looks down at a smartphone screen displaying the Snapchat logo, a yellow screen with a white ghost cartoon

props.synopsis: As the social media ban for kids under 16 approaches, popular messaging app Snapchat says young people will be able to verify their age by sending a selfie or their ID to a third-party platform, but sharing sensitive data carries risks.

title.children: Cybersecurity experts alarmed by Snapchat's age-verification plan

image.altText: Two people sit talking in an outdoor setting.

props.synopsis: As Gardening Australia's longest-serving presenter, Jane Edmanson says farewell and shares the secrets behind the success of Australia’s favourite gardening program.

title.children: After 38 years, Jane Edmanson is hanging up her Gardening Australia gloves

image.altText: Picture of lit up dome and theme park

props.synopsis: A mega theme park and entertainment precinct has been proposed for a rural township between Brisbane and the Sunshine Coast. But will this one happen?

title.children: Will this $2.6b theme park succeed where others have failed?

image.altText: an outback pub with a sign walkabout crek hotel a young family stand under the sign, two parents, two kids

props.synopsis: Think you’ve had your ears to the ground? It’s time to test your knowledge of the week that was.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: The G20 summit, a cyclone and a very famous pub

image.altText: Frozen Elsa Disney pic

props.synopsis: It wasn't just a box office success — Frozen introduced a new type of Disney princess: one who was strong, flawed and uninterested in romance.

title.children: Frozen flipped the script on the Disney princess narrative

image.altText: A woman in an apron carefully examines a scrapbook of dried seaweed.

props.synopsis: The State Library of WA is running an appeal to save a set of seaweed scrapbooks made nearly 100 years ago by a renowned Kalgoorlie-born naturalist.

title.children: Discovery of near century-old scrapbooks reveals seaweed secrets

image.altText: A red and yellow striped balloon in the air with clouds around it.

props.synopsis: A report by the national transport safety investigator finds hot air balloon rides come with a higher risk of injuries than a joy flight in a light plane or a helicopter.

title.children: Hot air balloon rides nearly 10 times riskier than helicopter or plane

image.altText: Breanna Koenen and Jasmine Garner hold the premiership cup

props.synopsis: Wondering what time the AFLW grand final starts and how you can watch it live? We've got you covered.

title.children: Everything you need to know ahead of the 2025 AFLW grand final

image.altText: a woman wearing a santa hat and apron scoops prawns at a fish market

props.synopsis: Wild-caught Aussie prawn fishers are reporting a tough catch season. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: Why you could be paying more for your Christmas prawns this year

image.altText: An Asian baby boy sitting on high chair while eating. Baby boy is being fed by mother at home

props.synopsis: Allergen starter kits promise to make introducing foods to babies easier, but experts are concerned they may not be effective.

title.children: Allergen starter packs are meant to take the load off parents. But do they?

image.altText: person who is blurred walks in front of the new york stock exchange, sign says wall street

props.synopsis: Exchange operator CME Group said trading in derivative markets was halted due to a cooling issue at data centres. The tech issue is affecting Wall Street futures trading.

title.children: US futures markets halted

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Trump announces major new stance on migration
Interest rates outlook supporting Australian dollar

image.altText: A shopper carrying a bag walks past a shop in Perth's city centre

props.synopsis: As scammers look to exploit sales during Black Friday and Cyber Monday we explain what you need to know to avoid being duped.

title.children: How to spot a scam during Black Friday and Cyber Monday

image.altText: An image of a man clad in black throwing an object.

props.synopsis: Two men have been charged with assaulting police at a rally in Melbourne's CBD in October. The arrests come as police prepare for another demonstration in the city on Sunday.

title.children: More arrests over protest violence as police prepare for another Melbourne rally

image.altText: Golfer Fuzzy Zoeller looking down the fiarway after hitting a driver

props.synopsis: Fuzzy Zoeller, a two-time major champion and one of golf's most gregarious characters whose career was tainted by a racially insensitive joke about Tiger Woods, has died aged 74.

title.children: Fuzzy Zoeller, who beat Greg Norman to win 1984 US Open playoff, dies

image.altText: Emmanuel Macron speaks into a microphone with several military people behind him.

props.synopsis: French President Emmanuel Macron is reintroducing voluntary military service almost three decades after it was scrapped.

title.children: France to reintroduce voluntary military service amid growing threat of war with Russia

image.altText: A woman with long, blonde hair is formally dressed as she sits in front of a large set of shelves.

props.synopsis: Not all Australians aged under 16 will "magically disappear overnight" from social media, the nation's online safety regulator says, amid a legal challenge to pause the start of the federal government's ban.

title.children: Social media ban implementation will 'vary' across platforms, regulator warns

image.altText: Large rectangular slabs of rock with water from a river entering from one side in which people are swimming in.

props.synopsis: From 'Pondi' to Sydney Harbour, here's when your popular spots will reopen.

title.children: New-look Sydney swimming spots reopening so you can beat the heat
